movie_title: Why Scientists Are Puzzled By This Virus
introduction: Build a life of learning with Imprint. Go to https://imprintapp.com/Kurzgesagt_LIB to start your jou

vocabulary.definition: an extremely large number, more than a million million
vocabulary.example: There are trillions of bacteria living in your gut.

vocabulary.definition: the collection of viruses present in or on the human body
vocabulary.example: The virome plays a crucial role in maintaining the body's health.

vocabulary.definition: involving interaction between two different organisms living in close physical association
vocabulary.example: The relationship between viruses and bacteria in the gut is symbiotic.

vocabulary.definition: the complete set of genes or genetic material present in a cell or organism
vocabulary.example: Scientists study the genome of viruses to understand their behavior.

vocabulary.definition: people or things that secretly become part of a group in order to get information or to influence the way the group thinks or behaves
vocabulary.example: Oncolytic viruses act as infiltrators within cancer cells.

vocabulary.definition: an event that happens by chance or that is unexpected
vocabulary.example: The discovery of oncolytic viruses may have been a happy accident in medical research.
